job.title: Plant Accountant
job.description: The Plant Accountant will function as a business partner with plant and financial management to effectively manage and control the divisions assigned. Lead the accounting function at the plant and/or related facilities and be accountable for plant-level responsibilities including general accounting, payroll, cost accounting, business analysis, financial reporting, budgeting, quarterly forecasting, and capital project financial analysis. Will also liaison with corporate financial staff regularly. Responsibilities: Responsible for internal controls at the plant and related facilities for operations, sales, finance, and accounting Submit all financial transactions, transmissions, and reporting for a timely month-end close and accurate basis Ensure the accuracy of the physical inventory and reported results; investigate and explain physical adjustments; review and write off obsolete inventory as needed Responsible for preparation of annual budgets and quarterly reforecast of plant’s financial operations Prepare and analyze weekly and monthly reports of results as required or requested, to be completed accurately and in accordance with the corporate format and due date Assist in the preparation of capital expenditure financial analysis to ensure accuracy of cost data used Manage fixed assets; perform periodic audits; maintain depreciation schedules Attend and participate in meetings as needed Perform periodic walkthroughs of the plant with the Operations and/or Plant Manager to discuss production and cost issues Analyze reports for labor and material costs, manufacturing overhead, distribution cost, quality control, and inventory levels Assist with year-end audit and other audits and inquiries as required Reconcile all balance sheet accounts monthly and make required adjustments where needed Understand and document multiple business and accounting systems, reporting conventions and other systems Set SMART goals (Specific, Measurable, Aligned/Agreed, Relevant, Timely); perform/document monthly coaching against goals, conduct performance reviews including identifying and communicating development needs for all direct reports and/or matrix reports. Follow and adhere to all QMS procedures and documentation as applicable to position/department and as required by ISO All other duties and projects as assigned Job Requirements and Skill Sets: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration MBA or CPA is preferred but not required 8 years of relevant experience in a mining/manufacturing environment and/or public accounting Ability to work independently Ability to lead/motivate staff effectively to achieve goals and provide coaching intended to develop them to their fullest potential Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential Organizational savvy to effectively convey ideas and concepts Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel Ability to travel independently (domestic) with a valid drivers license
